intro: Dietes flavida, commonly known as the golden yellow daisies, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Dietes flavida is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
